intro: Caamembeca, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with upright stems and clustered foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Caamembeca thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
